subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Innovation Accounting
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Innovation Accounting.

hook.text: How do you measure progress when you have no revenue, no users, and no product?

buildup.text: Traditional accounting measures profit and loss. But startups have neither for months or years.

discovery.text: Innovation accounting uses three steps: set a baseline, tune the engine, then decide to pivot or persist.

twist.text: Intuit used innovation accounting to evaluate internal startups. Ideas that couldn't show learning got cut.

climax.text: It gave managers an objective way to judge experiments instead of relying on gut feelings and politics.

punchline.text: If you can't measure learning, you can't manage innovation.

quiz.question: What are the three steps of innovation accounting?
options: Set a baseline, tune the engine, decide to pivot or persist
Raise funding, build product, measure revenue
